p.s: Description of Streptomyces spitsbergensis sp. nov.
Streptomyces spitsbergensis (spits.ber.gen'sis. L. deriv. spitsbergensis, of Spitsbergen, the source of the soil sample from which the type strain was isolated)
The color of branching substrate mycelium ranges from red to reddish brown, depending on the growth medium.
Aerial mycelium is pink to violet.
The species produces some prodiginine-like metabolites with immunosuppressive activity.
Soluble pigments (including melanin) are not produced.
Nitrate is not reduced; other physiological properties are summarized above.
Grows well at 25 to 37°C; no growth occurs at 45°C.
Type I cell wall and type PII phospholipid pattern (saturated iso and anteiso fatty acids, lack of mycolic acids and major glycolipids) .
The G+C content of the DNA is 71 mol% (as determined by the thermal denaturation method).
The type strain is strain PCM 2404.
